org.assertj.swing.fixture
Class AbstractComponentFixture<S,C extends Component,D extends ComponentDriver>

java.lang.Object
  org.assertj.swing.fixture.AbstractComponentFixture<S,C,D>
Type Parameters:
S - used to simulate "self types." For more information please read "Emulating 'self types' using Java Generics to simplify fluent API implementation."
C - the type of Component that this fixture can manage.
D - the type of ComponentDriver that this fixture uses internally.
All Implemented Interfaces:
MouseInputSimulationFixture<S>
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractContainerFixture, AbstractJComponentFixture
public abstract class AbstractComponentFixture<S,C extends Component,D extends ComponentDriver>
extends Object
implements MouseInputSimulationFixture<S>

Supports functional testing of AWT and Swing Components.

Author:
Alex Ruiz, Yvonne Wang

Constructor Detail

AbstractComponentFixture

public AbstractComponentFixture(@Nonnull
                                Class<S> selfType,
                                @Nonnull
                                Robot robot,
                                @Nonnull
                                Class<? extends C> type)
Creates a new AbstractComponentFixture.

Parameters:
selfType - the "self type."
robot - performs simulation of user events on a Component.
type - the type of the Component to find using the given Robot.
Throws:
NullPointerException - if robot is null.
NullPointerException - if type is null.
ComponentLookupException - if a matching component could not be found.
ComponentLookupException - if more than one matching component is found.

                                @Nullable
                                String name,

                                Class<? extends C> type)

                                @Nonnull
                                Robot robot,
                                @Nonnull
                                C target)
Creates a new AbstractComponentFixture.

Parameters:
selfType - the "self type."
robot - performs simulation of user events on the given Component.
target - the Component to be managed by this fixture.
Throws:
NullPointerException - if selfType is null.
NullPointerException - if robot is null.
NullPointerException - if target is null.

pressAndReleaseKey

@Nonnull
public final S pressAndReleaseKey(@Nonnull
                                          KeyPressInfo keyPressInfo)
Simulates a user pressing given key with the given modifiers on this fixture's Component. Modifiers is a mask from the available AWT InputEvent masks.

Parameters:
keyPressInfo - specifies the key and modifiers to press.
Returns:
this fixture.
Throws:
NullPointerException - if the given KeyPressInfo is null.
IllegalArgumentException - if the given code is not a valid key code.
IllegalStateException - if this fixture's Component is disabled.
IllegalStateException - if this fixture's Component is not showing on the screen.
See Also:
KeyPressInfo

pressAndReleaseKeys

@Nonnull
public final S pressAndReleaseKeys(@Nonnull
                                           int... keyCodes)
Simulates a user pressing and releasing the given keys on this fixture's Component.

Parameters:
keyCodes - one or more codes of the keys to press.
Returns:
this fixture.
Throws:
NullPointerException - if the given array of codes is null.
IllegalArgumentException - if any of the given code is not a valid key code.
IllegalStateException - if this fixture's Component is disabled.
IllegalStateException - if this fixture's Component is not showing on the screen.
See Also:
KeyEvent

requireShowing

protected boolean requireShowing()
Returns whether showing components are the only ones participating in a component lookup. The returned value is obtained from the component lookup scope stored in this fixture's Robot.

Returns:
true if only showing components can participate in a component lookup, false otherwise.

font

@Nonnull
public final FontFixture font()
Returns:
a fixture that checks properties of the font of this fixture's Component.

background

@Nonnull
public final ColorFixture background()
Returns:
a fixture that checks properties of the background color of this fixture's Component.

foreground

@Nonnull
public final ColorFixture foreground()
Returns:
a fixture that checks properties of the foreground color of this fixture's Component.

isEnabled

public final boolean isEnabled()
Indicates whether this fixture's Component is enabled.

Returns:
true if this fixture's Component is enabled; false otherwise.

targetCastedTo

@Nonnull
public final <T extends C> T targetCastedTo(@Nonnull
                                                    Class<T> type)
Returns this fixture's Component casted to the given sub-type.

Parameters:
type - the type that the managed Component will be casted to.
Returns:
this fixture's Component casted to the given sub-type.
Throws:
AssertionError - if this fixture's Component is not an instance of the given type.

target

@Nonnull
public final C target()

Returns the GUI component in this fixture.

Note: Access to the GUI component returned by this method must be executed in the event dispatch thread (EDT.) To do so, please execute a GuiQuery or GuiTask (depending on what you need to do,) inside a GuiActionRunner. To learn more about Swing threading, please read the Swing Threading Policy.

Returns:
the GUI component in this fixture.

robot

@Nonnull
protected final Robot robot()
Returns:
the Robot that simulates user events on target().

myself

@Nonnull
protected final S myself()
Returns:
this casted to the "self type".
